00034 /* static filesystem info.
00035  * The access is thread-safe because
00036  * it is read-only, except during initialization.
00037  */
00038 fsal_staticfsinfo_t           global_fs_info;
00039 fsal_posixdb_conn_params_t    global_posixdb_params;
00040 
00041 /* filesystem info for HPSS */
00042 static fsal_staticfsinfo_t default_posix_info =
00043   {
00044     0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFLL, /* max file size (64bits) */
00045     _POSIX_LINK_MAX, /* max links */
00046     FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN, /* max filename */
00047     FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, /* min filename */
00048     TRUE,  /* no_trunc */
00049     TRUE,  /* chown restricted */
00050     FALSE, /* case insensitivity */
00051     TRUE,  /* case preserving */
00052     FSAL_EXPTYPE_PERSISTENT, /* FH expire type */
00053     TRUE, /* hard link support */
00054     TRUE, /* symlink support */
00055     FALSE, /* lock management */    
00056     TRUE, /* named attributes */
00057     TRUE,  /* handles are unique and persistent */
00058     {10,0}, /* Duration of lease at FS in seconds */
00059     FSAL_ACLSUPPORT_ALLOW,     /* ACL support */
00060     TRUE,  /* can change times */
00061     TRUE,  /* homogenous */
00062     POSIX_SUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTES, /* supported attributes */
00063     0,     /* maxread size */
00064     0,     /* maxwrite size */
00065     0,      /* default umask */
00066     0,     /* cross junctions */
00067     0400   /* default access rights for xattrs: root=RW, owner=R */
00068   };

00077 /* variables for limiting the calls to the filesystem */
00078 static int limit_calls = FALSE;
00079 semaphore_t sem_fs_calls;

00081 
00082 /* threads keys for stats */
00083 static pthread_key_t key_stats ;
00084 static pthread_once_t once_key = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT ;
00085 
00086 /* init keys */
00087 static void init_keys( void )
00088 {
00089   if( pthread_key_create( &key_stats, NULL ) == -1 )
00090       DisplayErrorJd( fsal_log, ERR_SYS , ERR_PTHREAD_KEY_CREATE, errno );
00091   
00092   return ;
00093 } /* init_keys */

00095 
00107 void fsal_increment_nbcall( int function_index , fsal_status_t  status )
00108 {
00109   
00110   fsal_statistics_t * bythread_stat = NULL ;
00111 
00112   /* verify index */
00113   
00114   if (function_index >= FSAL_NB_FUNC) return;
00115   
00116   /* first, we init the keys if this is the first time */
00117   
00118   if( pthread_once( &once_key, init_keys ) != 0 )
00119   {
00120     DisplayErrorJd( fsal_log, ERR_SYS, ERR_PTHREAD_ONCE, errno );
00121     return;
00122   }
00123   
00124   /* we get the specific value */
00125   
00126   bythread_stat = (fsal_statistics_t *) pthread_getspecific( key_stats ) ;
00127   
00128   /* we allocate stats if this is the first time */
00129   
00130   if( bythread_stat == NULL )
00131   {
00132       int i;
00133       
00134       bythread_stat =
00135             (fsal_statistics_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof(fsal_statistics_t )) ;
00136       
00137       if( bythread_stat == NULL )
00138       {
00139         DisplayErrorJd( fsal_log, ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, Mem_Errno );
00140       }
00141       
00142       /* inits the struct */
00143       
00144       for (i=0;i<FSAL_NB_FUNC;i++)
00145       {
00146          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_call[i]=0;
00147          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_success[i]=0;
00148          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_retryable[i]=0;
00149          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[i]=0;
00150       }
00151       
00152       /* set the specific value */
00153       pthread_setspecific( key_stats , (void *)bythread_stat ) ;
00154 
00155   }
00156     
00157   /* we increment the values */
00158   
00159   if ( bythread_stat )
00160   {
00161     bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_call[function_index]++;
00162     
00163     if (  ! FSAL_IS_ERROR(status) )
00164       bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_success[function_index]++;
00165     else if ( fsal_is_retryable(status) )
00166       bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_retryable[function_index]++;
00167     else 
00168       bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[function_index]++;    
00169   }
00170   
00171   return;
00172 }

00175 
00186 void fsal_internal_getstats(fsal_statistics_t * output_stats)
00187 {
00188 
00189   fsal_statistics_t * bythread_stat = NULL ;
00190     
00191   /* first, we init the keys if this is the first time */
00192   if( pthread_once( &once_key, init_keys ) != 0 ){
00193     DisplayErrorJd(fsal_log, ERR_SYS, ERR_PTHREAD_ONCE, errno );
00194     return;
00195   }
00196   
00197   /* we get the specific value */
00198   bythread_stat = (fsal_statistics_t *) pthread_getspecific( key_stats ) ;
00199   
00200   /* we allocate stats if this is the first time */
00201   if( bythread_stat == NULL ){
00202       int i;
00203            
00204       if( (
00205             bythread_stat =
00206             (fsal_statistics_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof(fsal_statistics_t ))
00207            ) == NULL )
00208         DisplayErrorJd(fsal_log, ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, Mem_Errno );
00209       
00210       /* inits the struct */
00211       for (i=0;i<FSAL_NB_FUNC;i++){
00212          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_call[i]=0;
00213          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_success[i]=0;
00214          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_retryable[i]=0;
00215          bythread_stat->func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[i]=0;
00216       }
00217       
00218       /* set the specific value */
00219       pthread_setspecific( key_stats , (void *)bythread_stat ) ;
00220 
00221   }
00222   
00223   if (output_stats)
00224     (*output_stats)=(*bythread_stat);
00225   
00226   return;
00227   
00228 }

00246 
00250 void  TakeTokenFSCall()
00251 {
00252   /* no limits */
00253   if ( limit_calls == FALSE ) return;
00254   
00255   /* there is a limit */  
00256   semaphore_P( &sem_fs_calls );
00257   
00258 }
00259 
00260 void  ReleaseTokenFSCall()
00261 {
00262   /* no limits */
00263   if ( limit_calls == FALSE ) return;
00264   
00265   /* there is a limit */  
00266   semaphore_V( &sem_fs_calls );
00267   
00268 }

00272 
00273 #define SET_INTEGER_PARAM( cfg, p_init_info, _field )             \
00274     switch( (p_init_info)->behaviors._field ){                    \
00275     case FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE :                                  \
00276       /* force the value in any case */                           \
00277       cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field;                  \
00278       break;                                                      \
00279     case FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT :                                    \
00280       /* check the higher limit */                                \
00281       if ( cfg._field > (p_init_info)->values._field )            \
00282         cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field ;               \
00283       break;                                                      \
00284     case FSAL_INIT_MIN_LIMIT :                                    \
00285       /* check the lower limit */                                 \
00286       if ( cfg._field < (p_init_info)->values._field )            \
00287         cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field ;               \
00288       break;                                                      \
00289     /* In the other cases, we keep the default value. */          \
00290     }
00291     
00292 
00293 #define SET_BITMAP_PARAM( cfg, p_init_info, _field )              \
00294     switch( (p_init_info)->behaviors._field ){                    \
00295     case FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE :                                  \
00296         /* force the value in any case */                         \
00297         cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field;                \
00298         break;                                                    \
00299     case FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT :                                    \
00300       /* proceed a bit AND */                                     \
00301       cfg._field &= (p_init_info)->values._field ;                \
00302       break;                                                      \
00303     case FSAL_INIT_MIN_LIMIT :                                    \
00304       /* proceed a bit OR */                                      \
00305       cfg._field |= (p_init_info)->values._field ;                \
00306       break;                                                      \
00307     /* In the other cases, we keep the default value. */          \
00308     }
00309 
00310 
00311 #define SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( cfg, p_init_info, _field )             \
00312     switch( (p_init_info)->behaviors._field ){                    \
00313     case FSAL_INIT_FORCE_VALUE :                                  \
00314         /* force the value in any case */                         \
00315         cfg._field = (p_init_info)->values._field;                \
00316         break;                                                    \
00317     case FSAL_INIT_MAX_LIMIT :                                    \
00318       /* proceed a boolean AND */                                 \
00319       cfg._field = cfg._field && (p_init_info)->values._field ;   \
00320       break;                                                      \
00321     case FSAL_INIT_MIN_LIMIT :                                    \
00322       /* proceed a boolean OR */                                  \
00323       cfg._field = cfg._field && (p_init_info)->values._field ;   \
00324       break;                                                      \
00325     /* In the other cases, we keep the default value. */          \
00326     }
00327

00329 /*
00330  *  This function initializes shared variables of the fsal.
00331  */
00332 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_init_global( fsal_init_info_t       * fsal_info ,
00333                                          fs_common_initinfo_t   * fs_common_info,
00334                                          fs_specific_initinfo_t * fs_specific_info)
00335 {
00336   
00337   
00338   /* sanity check */
00339   if (!fsal_info || !fs_common_info || !fs_specific_info) ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT,0);
00340   
00341   /* Setting log info */
00342   fsal_log = fsal_info->log_outputs;
00343   
00344   
00345   /* inits FS call semaphore */
00346   if ( fsal_info->max_fs_calls > 0 )
00347   {
00348     int rc;
00349     
00350     limit_calls = TRUE;
00351     
00352     rc=semaphore_init(&sem_fs_calls, fsal_info->max_fs_calls);
00353     
00354     if (rc != 0) ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT,rc);
00355     
00356     DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,
00357         "FSAL INIT: Max simultaneous calls to filesystem is limited to %u.", 
00358         fsal_info->max_fs_calls );
00359     
00360   }
00361   else
00362   {
00363     DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,
00364         "FSAL INIT: Max simultaneous calls to filesystem is unlimited." );
00365   }
00366   
00367   
00368   /* setting default values. */
00369   global_fs_info = default_posix_info;
00370 
00371 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL
00372   
00373 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"{");
00374 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxfilesize  = %llX    ",default_posix_info.maxfilesize);
00375 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxlink  = %lu   ",default_posix_info.maxlink);
00376 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxnamelen  = %lu  ",default_posix_info.maxnamelen);
00377 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxpathlen  = %lu  ",default_posix_info.maxpathlen);
00378 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  no_trunc  = %d ",default_posix_info.no_trunc);
00379 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  chown_restricted  = %d ",default_posix_info.chown_restricted);
00380 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  case_insensitive  = %d ",default_posix_info.case_insensitive);
00381 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  case_preserving  = %d ",default_posix_info.case_preserving);
00382 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  fh_expire_type  = %hu ",default_posix_info.fh_expire_type);
00383 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  link_support  = %d  ",default_posix_info.link_support);
00384 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  symlink_support  = %d  ",default_posix_info.symlink_support);
00385 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  lock_support  = %d  ",default_posix_info.lock_support);
00386 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  named_attr  = %d  ",default_posix_info.named_attr);
00387 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  unique_handles  = %d  ",default_posix_info.unique_handles);
00388 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  acl_support  = %hu  ",default_posix_info.acl_support);
00389 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  cansettime  = %d  ",default_posix_info.cansettime);
00390 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  homogenous  = %d  ",default_posix_info.homogenous);
00391 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  supported_attrs  = %llX  ",default_posix_info.supported_attrs);
00392 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxread  = %llX     ",default_posix_info.maxread);
00393 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  maxwrite  = %llX     ",default_posix_info.maxwrite);
00394 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"  umask  = %X ",default_posix_info.umask);
00395 DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,"}");
00396   
00397 #endif
00398   
00399   
00400   /* Analyzing fs_common_info struct */  
00401   
00402   if (
00403       (fs_common_info->behaviors.maxfilesize != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00404       (fs_common_info->behaviors.maxlink  != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00405       (fs_common_info->behaviors.maxnamelen != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00406       (fs_common_info->behaviors.maxpathlen != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00407       (fs_common_info->behaviors.no_trunc != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00408       (fs_common_info->behaviors.case_insensitive != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00409       (fs_common_info->behaviors.case_preserving != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00410       (fs_common_info->behaviors.named_attr != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00411       (fs_common_info->behaviors.lease_time != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00412       (fs_common_info->behaviors.supported_attrs != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) ||
00413       (fs_common_info->behaviors.homogenous != FSAL_INIT_FS_DEFAULT ) )
00414       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NOTSUPP,0);
00415 
00416   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, symlink_support );
00417   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, link_support );
00418   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, lock_support );
00419   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, cansettime );
00420   
00421   SET_INTEGER_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, maxread );
00422   SET_INTEGER_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, maxwrite );
00423   
00424   SET_BITMAP_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, umask );
00425 
00426   SET_BOOLEAN_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, auth_exportpath_xdev );
00427 
00428   SET_BITMAP_PARAM( global_fs_info, fs_common_info, xattr_access_rights );
00429 
00430 
00431   /* setting global database parameters */
00432   global_posixdb_params = fs_specific_info->dbparams;
00433   
00434 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL
00435   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_FULL_DEBUG,
00436         "Supported attributes constant = 0x%llX.", 
00437         POSIX_SUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTES );  
00438   
00439   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_FULL_DEBUG,
00440         "Supported attributes default = 0x%llX.",
00441         default_posix_info.supported_attrs );  
00442 #endif
00443     
00444   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_DEBUG,
00445         "FSAL INIT: Supported attributes mask = 0x%llX.", 
00446         global_fs_info.supported_attrs );  
00447 
00448   /* initialize database cache*/
00449   if ( fsal_posixdb_cache_init() )
00450       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT,0);
00451 
00452   
00453   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR,0);
00454 }

00464 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(struct stat *buffstat, fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t *info)
00465 {
00466   /* sanity check */
00467   if (!info || !buffstat) ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT,0);
00468   
00469   memset(info, 0, sizeof(fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t));
00470   info->devid = buffstat->st_dev;
00471   info->inode = buffstat->st_ino;
00472   info->nlink = (int) buffstat->st_nlink;
00473   info->ctime = buffstat->st_ctime;
00474   info->ftype = posix2fsal_type(buffstat->st_mode);
00475   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0);
00476 }
00477 
00478 /*
00479  *  This function adds an entry in the database
00480  */
00481 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( fsal_posixdb_conn *p_conn, 
00482                                  fsal_name_t *p_filename, 
00483                                  fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t *p_info, 
00484                                  fsal_handle_t *p_dir_handle, 
00485                                  fsal_handle_t *p_new_handle)
00486 {
00487   fsal_posixdb_status_t stdb;
00488    
00489   if (!p_info || !p_conn || !p_new_handle) /* p_filename & p_dir_handle can be NULL for the root */ 
00490     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT,0);
00491 
00492 add:  
00493   stdb = fsal_posixdb_add( p_conn, p_info, p_dir_handle, p_filename, p_new_handle );
00494   
00495   if (stdb.major == ERR_FSAL_POSIXDB_CONSISTENCY) { /* there is already an entry with this path, but it's an inconsistent one */
00496     stdb = fsal_posixdb_deleteHandle(p_conn, p_new_handle);
00497     if ( FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(stdb) )
00498       return posixdb2fsal_error(stdb);
00499     goto add;
00500   } else if ( FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(stdb) ) {
00501     return posixdb2fsal_error(stdb);
00502   }
00503   
00504   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0);
00505 }
00506 
00515 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(fsal_path_t *p_path, fsal_name_t * p_name)
00516 {
00517   char *end;
00518   if (!p_path || !p_name)
00519     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT,0);
00520 
00521   end = p_path->path + p_path->len - 1;
00522   if (*end != '/') {
00523     if (p_path->len + 1 + p_name->len > FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN)
00524       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NAMETOOLONG, 0);
00525     p_path->len += p_name->len + 1;
00526     end++;
00527     *end = '/';
00528     end++;
00529     strcpy(end, p_name->name);
00530   } else {
00531     if (p_path->len + p_name->len > FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN)
00532       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NAMETOOLONG, 0);
00533     p_path->len += p_name->len;
00534     end++;
00535     strcpy(end, p_name->name);
00536   }
00537   
00538   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0);
00539 }
00540 
00545 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle( fsal_op_context_t      * p_context,  /* IN */
00546                                               fsal_handle_t           * p_handle,   /* IN */
00547                                               int                       is_dir,     /* IN */
00548                                               fsal_path_t             * p_fsalpath, /* OUT */
00549                                               struct stat             * p_buffstat /* OUT */)
00550 {
00551   fsal_status_t         status;
00552   fsal_posixdb_status_t statusdb;
00553   int rc, errsv, count, i;
00554   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t infofs;
00555   fsal_path_t paths[global_fs_info.maxlink];
00556 
00557   if ( !p_context || !p_handle || !p_fsalpath )
00558     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT, 0);
00559   
00560   /* if there is a path in the fsal_handle_t variable, then try to use it instead of querying the database for it */ 
00561   /* Read the path from the Handle. If it's valid & coherent, then no need to query the database ! */
00562   /* if !p_buffstat, we don't need to check the path*/
00563   statusdb = fsal_posixdb_getInfoFromHandle( p_context->p_conn,
00564                                              p_handle,
00565                                              paths,
00566                                              (is_dir ? 1 : global_fs_info.maxlink),
00567                                              &count);
00568   if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(statusdb) && FSAL_IS_ERROR(status = posixdb2fsal_error(statusdb))) return status;
00569 
00570   /* if !p_buffstat, then we do not stat the path to test if file is valid */
00571   if (p_buffstat) {
00572     for (i=0; i<count; i++) {
00573       TakeTokenFSCall();
00574       rc = lstat( paths[i].path, p_buffstat );
00575       errsv = errno;
00576       ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00577 
00578       if ( rc ) {
00579       /* error : delete the bad path from the database */
00580         char dirc[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00581         char basec[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00582         fsal_path_t parentdir;
00583         fsal_name_t filename;
00584         fsal_handle_t parenthdl;
00585         char *dname, *bname;
00586         
00587         /* split /path/to/filename in /path/to & filename */
00588         strncpy(dirc, paths[i].path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00589         strncpy(basec, paths[i].path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00590         dname = dirname(dirc);
00591         bname = basename(basec);
00592 
00593         status = FSAL_str2path( dname, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, &parentdir);
00594         status = FSAL_str2name( bname, FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN, &filename);
00595 
00596         /* get the handle of /path/to */
00597         status = FSAL_lookupPath( &parentdir, p_context, &parenthdl, NULL);
00598 
00599         if (!FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) {
00600           statusdb = fsal_posixdb_delete(p_context->p_conn, &parenthdl, &filename, NULL);
00601           /* no need to check if there was an error, because it doesn't change the behavior of the function */
00602         }
00603 
00604       } else { /* no error */
00605         FSAL_pathcpy( p_fsalpath, &(paths[0]) );
00606         break; 
00607       }
00608     }
00609     if (i==count) ReturnCode( ERR_FSAL_STALE, 0);
00610     
00611     /* check consistency */
00612     status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo( p_buffstat, &infofs ); 
00613     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) return status;
00614     
00615     if ( fsal_posixdb_consistency_check(&(p_handle->info), &infofs) ) {
00616       /* not consistent !! */
00617       /* delete the stale handle */
00618       statusdb = fsal_posixdb_deleteHandle( p_context->p_conn, p_handle );
00619       if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(statusdb) && FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = posixdb2fsal_error(statusdb) )) return status;
00620       
00621       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_STALE, 0);
00622     }
00623     
00624   } else {
00625       /* @TODO : check that there si at liste 1 path */
00626       FSAL_pathcpy( p_fsalpath, &(paths[0]) );
00627   }
00628   
00629   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0);
00630 }
00631 
00649 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_getInfoFromName( fsal_op_context_t       * p_context,  /* IN */
00650                                              fsal_handle_t           * p_parent_dir_handle,   /* IN */
00651                                              fsal_name_t             * p_fsalname, /* IN */
00652                                              fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t * p_infofs, /* IN */
00653                                              fsal_handle_t           * p_object_handle)   /* OUT */
00654 {
00655   fsal_posixdb_status_t   stdb;
00656   fsal_status_t           st;
00657 
00658   stdb = fsal_posixdb_getInfoFromName( p_context->p_conn, 
00659                                        p_parent_dir_handle, 
00660                                        p_fsalname, 
00661                                        NULL, 
00662                                        p_object_handle);
00663   switch (stdb.major) {
00664     case ERR_FSAL_POSIXDB_NOERR:
00665       /* No error, the object is in the database */
00666       /* check consistency */
00667       if ( fsal_posixdb_consistency_check(&(p_object_handle->info), p_infofs) ) {
00668         /* Entry not consistent */
00669         /* Delete the Handle entry, then add a new one (with a Parent entry) */
00670         stdb = fsal_posixdb_deleteHandle( p_context->p_conn, p_object_handle );
00671         if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(stdb) && FSAL_IS_ERROR( st = posixdb2fsal_error(stdb) )) return st;
00672         /* don't break, add a new entry */
00673       } else {
00674         break;
00675       }
00676     case ERR_FSAL_POSIXDB_NOENT:
00677       /* object not in the database, add a new entry */
00678       st = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_context->p_conn,
00679                                             p_fsalname,
00680                                             p_infofs,
00681                                             p_parent_dir_handle,
00682                                             p_object_handle);
00683       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st)) return st;
00684       break;
00685     default:
00686       /* error */
00687       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = posixdb2fsal_error(stdb))) return st;
00688   }
00689   
00690   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0);
00691 }
00692 
00693 
00694 
00714 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_getInfoFromChildrenList( fsal_op_context_t       * p_context,  /* IN */
00715                                                      fsal_handle_t           * p_parent_dir_handle,   /* IN */
00716                                                      fsal_name_t             * p_fsalname, /* IN */
00717                                                      fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t * p_infofs, /* IN */
00718                                                      fsal_posixdb_child      * p_children, /* IN */
00719                                                      unsigned int              children_count, /* IN */
00720                                                      fsal_handle_t           * p_object_handle)   /* OUT */
00721 {
00722   fsal_posixdb_status_t   stdb;
00723   fsal_status_t           st;
00724   int                     cmp = -1; /* when no children is available */
00725   unsigned int            count;
00726 
00727   /* sanity check */
00728   if ( !p_context || !p_parent_dir_handle || !p_fsalname || ( !p_children && children_count ) || !p_object_handle )
00729     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT, 0);
00730 
00731   /* check if the filename is in the list */
00732   for (count = 0; count < children_count; count++)
00733   {
00734     cmp = FSAL_namecmp( p_fsalname, &(p_children[count].name) );
00735     if (!cmp) break;
00736     /* maybe a sorted list could give better result */
00737   }
00738 
00739   switch (cmp) {
00740     case 0:
00741       /* Entry found : check consistency */
00742         
00743       if ( fsal_posixdb_consistency_check(&(p_children[count].handle.info), p_infofs) )
00744       {
00745         /* Entry not consistent */
00746         /* Delete the Handle entry, then add a new one (with a Parent entry) */
00747         stdb = fsal_posixdb_deleteHandle( p_context->p_conn, &(p_children[count].handle) );
00748         
00749         if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(stdb) && FSAL_IS_ERROR( st = posixdb2fsal_error(stdb) )) return st;
00750         
00751         /* don't break, add a new entry */
00752         
00753       }
00754       else
00755       {
00756         memcpy(p_object_handle, &(p_children[count].handle), sizeof(fsal_handle_t));
00757         break;
00758       }
00759       
00760     default:
00761       /* not found ! Add it */
00762       st = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_context->p_conn,
00763                                             p_fsalname,
00764                                             p_infofs,
00765                                             p_parent_dir_handle,
00766                                             p_object_handle);
00767       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st)) return st;
00768   }
00769 
00770   ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0);
00771 }
00772 
00773 
00774 /*
00775    Check the access from an existing fsal_attrib_list_t or struct stat
00776 */
00777 /* XXX : ACL */
00778 fsal_status_t fsal_internal_testAccess( fsal_op_context_t   * p_context,          /* IN */
00779                                         fsal_accessflags_t  access_type,          /* IN */
00780                                         struct stat         * p_buffstat,          /* IN */
00781                                         fsal_attrib_list_t  * p_object_attributes   /* IN */)
00782 {
00783   fsal_accessflags_t missing_access;
00784   unsigned int is_grp, i;
00785   fsal_uid_t uid;
00786   fsal_gid_t gid;
00787   fsal_accessmode_t mode;
00788   
00789   /* sanity checks. */
00790   
00791   if ( (!p_object_attributes && !p_buffstat) || !p_context)
00792     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_FAULT, 0);
00793   
00794   /* If the FSAL_F_OK flag is set, returns ERR INVAL*/  
00795   
00796   if ( access_type & FSAL_F_OK )
00797     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0);
00798   
00799   
00800   /* test root access */
00801   
00802   if ( p_context->credential.user == 0 )
00803     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 );
00804     
00805   /* unsatisfied flags */  
00806   
00807   missing_access = access_type;
00808 
00809   
00810   if (p_object_attributes) {
00811     uid = p_object_attributes->owner;
00812     gid = p_object_attributes->group;
00813     mode = p_object_attributes->mode;
00814   } else {
00815     uid = p_buffstat->st_uid;
00816     gid = p_buffstat->st_gid;
00817     mode = unix2fsal_mode( p_buffstat->st_mode );
00818   }
00819     
00820   /* Test if file belongs to user. */
00821  
00822   if ( p_context->credential.user == uid )
00823   {
00824     
00825 #if defined( _DEBUG_FSAL )
00826    DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "File belongs to user %d",
00827        uid );
00828 #endif
00829     
00830     if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_RUSR )
00831       missing_access &= ~FSAL_R_OK ;
00832 
00833     if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_WUSR )
00834       missing_access &= ~FSAL_W_OK ;
00835     
00836     if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_XUSR )
00837       missing_access &= ~FSAL_X_OK ;
00838     
00839     
00840     if ( missing_access == 0 )
00841       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0);
00842     else
00843       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_ACCESS, 0 );
00844     
00845      
00846   }
00847   
00848   /* Test if the file belongs to user's group. */
00849 
00850   is_grp = ( p_context->credential.group == gid );
00851   
00852 # ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL
00853   if (is_grp)
00854     DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "File belongs to user's group %d",
00855        p_context->credential.group );
00856 # endif
00857   
00858   /* Test if file belongs to alt user's groups */ 
00859  
00860   if ( !is_grp )
00861   {
00862     for ( i = 0; i < p_context->credential.nbgroups; i++ )
00863     {
00864       is_grp = ( p_context->credential.alt_groups[i] == gid );
00865 
00866       #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL
00867         if (is_grp)
00868           DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "File belongs to user's alt group %d",
00869              p_context->credential.alt_groups[i]  );
00870       #endif
00871             
00872       // exits loop if found
00873       if ( is_grp ) break;
00874     }
00875   }
00876     
00877   /* finally apply group rights */
00878   
00879   if ( is_grp )
00880   {
00881     if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_RGRP )
00882       missing_access &= ~FSAL_R_OK ;
00883 
00884     if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_WGRP )
00885       missing_access &= ~FSAL_W_OK ;
00886 
00887     if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_XGRP )
00888       missing_access &= ~FSAL_X_OK ;
00889     
00890     if ( missing_access == 0 )
00891       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR , 0 );
00892     else
00893       ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_ACCESS , 0 );
00894     
00895   }
00896   
00897       
00898   /* test other perms */  
00899       
00900   if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_ROTH )
00901     missing_access &= ~FSAL_R_OK ;
00902 
00903   if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_WOTH )
00904     missing_access &= ~FSAL_W_OK ;
00905 
00906   if ( mode & FSAL_MODE_XOTH )
00907     missing_access &= ~FSAL_X_OK ;
00908      
00909     
00910   /* XXX ACLs. */
00911   
00912   if ( missing_access == 0 )
00913     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 );
00914   else
00915     ReturnCode(ERR_FSAL_ACCESS , 0 );
00916   
00917   
00918 }
